intro: Acinodendron puberulum, commonly known as the hairy acinodendron, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are covered in fine, short hairs, giving it a pubescent appearance. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often producing a fragrant scent to attract pollinators. The fruit is a small capsule that releases seeds when mature, contributing to its reproductive strategy in the wild.
